Men and women came to the different places where meetings were appointed to be held, to see if they could not bring in their false theories. But although they would advance erroneous and sometimes fanatical teachings, we had the truth so firmly established in our minds that we had nothing to fear.--Letter 38, 1906, pp. 1,2. ("To the Wahroonga Sanitarium Family," January 23, 1906.) 

White Estate Washington, D.C. January 24, 1979
